Title: Parent Kickoff
Prep Homework: FOR PARENTS: 1. Complete Intake Questionnaire (parents)
Agenda Item Details: Review intake questionnaire. If other needs are uncovered during this conversation connect family to their Strategist to evaluate what additional support is needed.
To Do Item: FOR PARENTS: Optional - Listen to Get Wise Podcast. Episode 1 & 2
Roadmap One-Line Description: In this meeting, reserved just for parent and counselor, we’ll learn more about your family’s priorities so we can develop an admissions plan that will help you reach your specific goals.
Content: Intake Questionnaire (parent). Welcome to Schoolnet video (parent). Character Counts. Podcast Ep 1 & 2

Prep Homework: FOR PARENTS: 1. Watch Welcome to Schoolnet (parent).                                                          2. Watch Character Counts

Agenda Item Details: Best way to communicate via UMS including a tutorial of the system

Title: Student Kickoff
Prep Homework: 1. Complete Getting to Know You (students) 2. Watch Welcome to Schoolnet video (student).                                                          3. Watch Character Counts
Agenda Item Title: Review Getting to Know You Questionnaire
Roadmap One-Line Description: We’ll use this meeting to get to know you—your goals, your concerns, your personality, and your values. And together we’ll create a foundation for a smooth, successful journey to college.
Content: Getting to Know You (student). Welcome to Schoolnet (student). Character Counts

Prep Homework: 1. Compile and send relevant academic information: transcripts, test scores, etc
Agenda Item Details: Review transcript to-date. What are they taking, how are they going, etc.
Evaluate academic performance and study skills and identify any necessary tutoring support needed.

Title: Activity Assessment & Planning
Prep Homework: 1. FOR PARENTS: Watch The College Planning Opportunity Many Juniors Miss                                                                           2. FOR STUDENTS: Watch The College Planning Opportunity Many Juniors Miss       3. Fill out the Activity section in UMS       4. Watch How Colleges Really Evaluate Your Activities                                                          5. Write a short essay about an activity that has impacted you
Agenda Item Details: 1. Review activity section. Discuss how to focus and expand priority activities.               2. Recommendation on how to go deeper within one or two specific activities.                         3. Discuss how to pursue certain activities over summer/summer planning.                        4. Provide resources for family to research summer options if needed
To Do Item: FOR PARENTS: Optional - Listen to Get Wise Podcast. Episode 3 & 4
Roadmap One-Line Description: This in-depth check-in meeting with your counselor is your chance to review your progress, ask questions, and make any necessary adjustments to keep you on the path to admissions success.
Content: The College Planning Opportunity Many Juniors Miss. How Colleges Really Evaluate Your Activities. Goal Setting Progress Report. Podcast Ep. 3 & 4

Prep Homework: Schedule any necessary diagnostics prior to Testing meeting
Agenda Item Details: Evaluate academic performance and identify any necessary support needed. Evaluation of study skills and determine if any additional support is necessary
Fill out goals in the Goal Setting Progress Report. Set benchmark dates to check in on progress

Title: Testing (To be held with CAS team member and counselor)
Prep Homework: Complete assigned diagnostics
Agenda Item Details: 1. Review any test scores and diagnostics. Strategize on SAT/ACT test preference. Create a testing plan including recommendation of package/hours/service delivery format to meet student’s needs.      2. Discuss AP exams - determine AP exam preparation plan                                             4. Share any of these guides as needed: Guide to ACT, Guide to the PSAT, Guide to SAT as needed
Roadmap One-Line Description: Your counselor and one of our testing experts will work with you to fine-tune your standardized testing plan and make sure you’re well prepared for tests like the SAT, ACT, and AP exams.
Content: Overview of Testing. To Test or Not to Test. Testing FAQ. Guide to ACT. Guide to the PSAT. Guide to the SAT.

Prep Homework: 1. Watch Overview of Testing                        2. Read the Testing FAQ                                 3. Watch To Test or Not to Test                      4. Writing Assignment: In the past year, which movie, play, book, song, or any other piece of artistic or cultural expression has impacted you most and how?
Agenda Item Details: Review the role of testing in the admissions process (there should be an emphasis on that while testing can’t get you in, it can keep you out at many HSCs).

Title: Introduction to College Research
Prep Homework: 1. Watch Overview of Colleges                       2. Watch What do You Want in a College?     3. FOR PARENTS: Fill out College Questionnaire
Agenda Item Details: 1. Students answer college search questions (embedded in UMS) during the meeting via a conversation with their counselor-yielding a more productive and strategic, in-depth conversation.                                         2. Provide curated list of schools based off questionnaire for preliminary research
To Do Item: FOR PARENTS: Optional - Listen to Get Wise Podcast. Episode 5
Roadmap One-Line Description: A thoughtful college search can help you find the right schools and become more competitive for those that already interest you. We’ll use this meeting to get you started.
Content: Overview of Colleges. What do you want in a college? College fairs, rep visits, and other college search resources. Parent College Questionnaire. Podcast Ep. 5

Prep Homework: 1. Watch College fairs, rep visits, and other college search resources
Agenda Item Title: Utilizing school & local resources for research
Agenda Item Details: Discuss utilizing school & local resources for research (school counselor, college rep visits, local college fairs, etc)
Follow-up conversation re: summer planning.

Title: Summer Planning (Summer before 12th)
Prep Homework: 1. If you haven’t read it yet, read the Summer Planning Guide                                                 2. Writing Assignment: if you were given a week to do whatever you wanted (consider money no object), what would you do?
Agenda Item Details: Summer Planning. Ask them to assess last summer – was it fun? What was the highlight?
Roadmap One-Line Description: We’ll revisit your previous summer, discuss how you might like to spend your break from school, and help you plan a summer that’s productive and enjoyable.
Content: Summer Planning Guide. College fairs, rep visits, and other college search resources. College Visits Overview

Agenda Item Details: If this is a STEM or fine arts student, this should be a more pointed conversation about how to build hands-on experience and/or contribute to a portfolio.
1. Assign ideas to research                             2. See if they'd be open to reading 1-2 books for fun. Talk through potential ideas.
Share a few specific programs with families that would be a good match for the student.

Prep Homework: 1. Watch College fairs, rep visits, and other college search resources                                2. Watch College Visits Overview
Agenda Item Details: Discuss attending college fairs and opportunities to visit colleges in conjunction with family travel plans
Register student for any diagnostics that need to be taken (SAT, ACT or both)
Evaluate academic performance and identify any necessary support needed. Evaluation of study skills and determine if any additional support is necessary

Title: College Research Round Two & Major Discussion
Prep Homework: 1. Research suggested college list                   2. Watch Highly Selected Colleges                 3. Watch Building a Balanced College List
Agenda Item Details: 1. Review research.                                           2. Provide an updated list of colleges to research based off initial findings
Roadmap One-Line Description: Based on your feedback, your counselor will help you refine your college list and consider potential academic plans in college (even if you don’t yet know what you want to study).
Content: Highly Selected Colleges. Building a balanced college list. Academic opportunities in college.

Prep Homework: 1. Watch Academic Opportunities in College
Agenda Item Details: Begin to discuss potential major choices, assign majors to research
Share resources with family re: college cost and financial aid eligibility to allow them to evaluate on their own

Title: Major Research & Course Selection
Prep Homework: 1. Research suggested college list                   2. Research & review major research             3. Fill in major questions for homework
Agenda Item Details: Review research. Continue to weave in major conversation as student completes research
To Do Item: FOR PARENTS: Optional - Listen to Get Wise Podcast. Episode 6
Roadmap One-Line Description: Your counselor will review your list of colleges, discuss your current academic interests, and recommend a 12th grade course schedule that will best help you reach your goals.
Content: Podcast Ep. 6

Prep Homework: Fill in the Coursework section with all final grades from 9th-11th
Agenda Item Details: 1. Review courses for 12th and confirm.        2. Discuss how the planned courses aligns with any major choices (if engineering, what coursework; if certain colleges, what coursework, etc).
Express gratitude to 1-2 favorite teachers

Title: College Visits & Letters of Recommendation
Prep Homework: Read College Visit Guide
Agenda Item Details: 1. Discuss college visits.                                     2. Make recommendations to the family based on the college list and provide resources to allow them to plan trips accordingly
Roadmap One-Line Description: This meeting focuses on two important parts of your college application process—planning college visits, and securing strong letters of recommendation from the right teachers.
Content: College Visit Guide. Letters of Recommendation FAQ. Which teachers should write your letters of recommendation?

Prep Homework: 1. Read Letters of Recommendation FAQ       2. Watch Which teachers should write your letters of recommendation?                           3. Submit to SN counselor top three choices for teacher LOR and two supplemental LOR
Agenda Item Details: Discuss letters of recommendation choices and compare to requirements based on current list

Prep Homework: Research suggested college list

Title: College Research - Narrowing the List
Prep Homework: 1. Research suggested college list                    2. Read How to Navigate Demonstrated Interest
Agenda Item Details: 1. Review research on additional schools.      2. Discuss how to narrow the list & including program research.                                             3. Provide an updated list with any additional schools necessary to fill the gaps to balance the list
To Do Item: 1. Research any final schools and begin to narrow the list                                                 2. Watch Finalizing Your List: Part I                3. FOR PARENTS: Optional - Listen to Get Wise Podcast. Episode 7
Roadmap One-Line Description: Applying to too many colleges can have adverse effects on both your applications and your sanity. We’ll review your current progress towards creating a balanced and strategically smart final list of colleges.
Content: Finalizing Your List: Part 1. How to Navigate Demonstrated Interest. Podcast Ep. 7

Title: Check- in Meeting (ad hoc)
Agenda Item Details: Evaluate academic performance and identify any necessary support needed. Evaluation of study skills and determine if any additional support is necessary
Content: Goal Setting Progress Report.

Agenda Item Details: Discuss new avenues to pursue as needed
Revisit testing plans (adjust SAT/ACT timeline depending on scores, Subject Tests if needed, discuss AP exams and necessary prep
Revisit summer plans (decisions made on any programs, confirm student applied, discuss other local opportunities if there is no summer program)
Identify college visit opportunities in conjunction with existing family travel plans

Agenda Item Title: Status check-in: Goal Setting Progress Report
Agenda Item Details: Counselor to add written updates on student’s progress

Title: Essay Brainstorming
Prep Homework: FOR STUDENTS:                                              1. Watch Essay Brainstorming                        2. Read this blogpost on the importance of the college essay                                             3. Complete the brainstorming exercises in the Prompt tab                                                4. Block off the remainder of the brainstorming day for writing
Agenda Item Details: Brainstorm and outline perosnal statement
To Do Item: 1. Submit your first draft within 24 hours
Roadmap One-Line Description: Every student has a story worth telling—we’ll help you find yours to share with colleges. You’ll leave this meeting with an outline for a college essay that is thoughtful, engaging, and even fun to write.
Content: Essay Brainstorming. Blogpost on the importance of the college essay. Letter to Parents on the essay process.

Prep Homework: FOR PARENTS:                                                                           1. Read this blogpost on the importance of the college essay                                             2. Review our Letter to Parents on the essay process

Title: Finalize the College List
Prep Homework: 1. Watch Finalize your List: Part II                   2. Watch Finalizing Letters of Recommendation                                            3. Visit school counselor for college list feedback
Agenda Item Details: 1. Finalize the college list                                2. Conisder EA & ED options                            3. Attend individual college info sessions at high schools for schools on the final list 4. Discuss the Common App and share Common App Guide
To Do Item: 1. Watch Early Decision vs Early Action          2. Once finalized, complete a “Why this school” note in UMS for each school you’d like to be on the final list                           3. Fill in your Common Applications               4. Ask your recommenders for letters             5. FOR PARENTS: Optional - Listen to Get Wise Podcast. Episode 8
Roadmap One-Line Description: Together we’ll finalize your college list, review potential application options like “early decision” and “early action,” and make sure you’re set for a smooth and successful path to admission.
Content: Common App Guide. Finalize your List: Part II. Finalizing Letters of Recommendation. Early Decision vs Early Action. Podcast Ep. 8

Agenda Item Details: Identify schools that require portfolio/auditions. Refer to Strategist to evaluate additional support needed.

Title: Senior Season Check-in Meetings (ad hoc)
Prep Homework: 1. Create and fill out Coalition App                  2. Create and fill out UC Application               3. Create and fill out Apply Texas                    4. Create and fill out Cal State                         5. Create and fill out the school-specific application for the school listed
To Do Item: 1. Work on assigned applications                   2. Watch the tutorial on How to open and start the Coalition application                         3. Watch the tutorial on How to open and start the UC application                                  4. Watch the tutorial on How to open and start the Apply Texas application                    5. Watch the tutorial on How to open and start the Cal State application                        6. Share the Apply Texas Guide
Roadmap One-Line Description: With strategic decisions complete, our work shifts to managing the application timeline, setting small, achievable goals, and bringing perspective to the process.
Content: How to open and start the Coalition application. How to open and start the UC application. How to open and start the Apply Texas application. How to open and start the Cal State application. Apply Texas Guide.

Title: These tasks and agenda items should not be tethered together. At this stage, a counselor should be able to add agenda items and to-do items as needed. Also should be noted that a counselor will be need to be able to add some of these more than once. But when they do, it will then become customized. For example, "Work on x applicaiton" could turn into "Work on Coalition application" and "Work on UC application"
Prep Homework: 1. Watch Supplement Essay: Overview                      2. Watch Supplement Essay: Why this Major?                                                               3. Watch Supplement Essay: Why this School?                                                            4. Watch Supplement Essay: University of California: Personal Insight Questions
Agenda Item Details: Brainstorm and outline supplement essays for the colleges listed
To Do Item: Write the first draft of each essay
Content: Supplement Essay: Overview. Supplement Essay: Why this Major? Supplement Essay: Why this School? Supplement Essay: University of California: Personal Insight Questions.

Agenda Item Details: Revisit testing plans (adjust SAT/ACT timeline depending on scores, Subject Tests if needed, discuss AP exams and necessary prep
Confirm which colleges need transcripts and method for sending.
To Do Item: 1. Send transcripts for the schools listed         2. Watch the Tutorial on How to send Transcripts
Content: Tutorials on how to send transcripts

Agenda Item Details: Discuss what test scores need to be sent to each school on the list.
To Do Item: 1. Send the test scores listed to the schools listed                                                                 2. Watch the Tutorial on How to send test scores
Content: Tutorial on how to send test scores

Agenda Item Details: Check in on status of letters of recommendation
To Do Item: 1. Confirm letters of recommendation have been sent to all schools                                   2. Read How to Write a Thank You Note Guide                                                                 3. Send thank you notes to your recommenders once the letters are sent
Content: How to write a thank you note guide.

Agenda Item Details: Confirm which school student is applying Early Decision

Prep Homework: Watch How to Have a Great Interview
Agenda Item Details: Share out information on interview process. If you would like additional support, we can discuss what that would look like.
To Do Item: Utilize the interview tracking information to track your interviews if needed
Content: How to have a great interview.

Agenda Item Details: 1. Walk through how to submit                       2. Submit first application
To Do Item: Submit application for the school listed!

Agenda Item Details: Share out information on financial aid deadlines. Remind families to submit FAFSA and CSS Profile
Plan any additional fall visits that are necessary
Continue demonstrating interest by attending events and engaging with the schools on the final list.

Title: Post-Application Check-in Meeting (ad hoc)
To Do Item: 1. Watch How to decode financial aid award letters                                                                2. Read the Guide to financial aid award letters
Content: How to decode financial aid award letters, Guide to financial aid award letters

Title: The vast majority in this section are actually more of to-do items then agenda items and most will be handled vie email. But I want the option for a meeting to be set. For this one can we set all these tasks as connected to this meeting even though there won't be agenda items?
To Do Item: Notify other colleges if admitted ED
Write and submit deferral letters
Update colleges with new information as needed
Send mid-year reporst after first semester is complete
Plan any post-application college visits
Confirm what AP exams to take and discuss any necessary prep
1. Watch Evaluating your College Options     2. Watch We're Disappointed Too                  3. Review college options
